p:
Lowering the level of dissimilarity (cut-off = 1, Figure 6), it is possible to divide this group into two subclusters (B”1 and B”2). Subcluster B”2 included two samples, (
D (
c )) and (
E (
c )), geographically close to each other and characterized by a high percentage of α-pinene (24.1–28.8%, respectively). The other two oils ((
S (
c )) and (
V (
c )), formed subgroup B”1. This cluster, in contrast to the previous subgroup B”2, had a higher content of hydrocarbon monoterpenes (62.8–72.7%) but a lower contribution of oxygenated monoterpenes (11.4–12.2%).
